Articles.Content:
Hi. As the title says I'm getting consistant crashes at launch. This is actually true for all my steam games.

I'm sure this is not stricly a KSP issue or maybe even a steam issue, but rather a wider issue on my PC.

When 1.0.2 came out it rune beautifully. No issues then.

I blame avast. All started when avast, after an update, suddenly decided that steam was a trojan and locked a few steam executables in the virus chest. After much trouble trying to convince avast that steam is infact a friend I ended up uninstalling avast and switched to MSE. Unfortunately that didn't help. But at least MSE understands that steam is nice for me. (Yes, I verified the gamefiles)

The next step was to backup my appdata folder and reinstall steam. Moved my appdata back over, but alas, no joy. Still crashing.(Yes, I verified the gamefiles, again.)

Fine. I did a hard reinstall of steam. Lost all my games. Oh the re-dowloading at ~650kb/s, I fear thee! Just downloaded KSP for now. Still no joy. Still a crash at game launch. Nothing wrong with the actual steam application. Nothing wrong with other programs. (Yes, I verified the gamefiles, again.)

I'm hoping that the more tech oriented of you might be able to give me clues where the issue lies by taking a look at the output log.

I much appreaciate your help!

KSP Version:

1.0.2

Screenshot:

N/A

Craft & Save Files:

Fresh install

Crash/Output Logs:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/5buy9k9yqfp0yug/output_log.txt?dl=0

System Specs:

Win 7 x64

AMD Phenom 4x

Nvidia Gt 630

6gigs RAM

Old PC but still working.

Edited May 11, 2015 by KingOfFinland
Replaced file host

Hi KingOfFinland, we'll try to help anyway, even if it's not KSP causing it

filehosting.org won't accept a disposable email though, and I don't fancy giving them my email address, can I trouble you to use pastebin.com?

I'd love to. This will take just a moment.

Apparently the output_log is over 512 kilobytes and as such I cannot paste it unless I'm a PRO user.

Lets see how expensive that is going to be...

EDIT: What I see in the log is a lot of "ARB shader compile error"

Edited May 11, 2015 by KingOfFinland
See edit

Eh don't then, dropbox is free.

Most logs fit on pastebin, so there must be errors written to it.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/5buy9k9yqfp0yug/output_log.txt?dl=0

Here is a new attempt at the output_log. I replaced the original links on the OP with this link too.

Thanks I'm reading it now.

Edit:

And straight away I see a problem, take a look.

Initialize engine version: 4.6.4f1 (99f88340878d)

GfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1

d3d: no support for this device type (accelerated/ref)

D3D9 initialization failed

GfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1

d3d11: failed to create D3D11 device (0x887a0004)

D3D11 initialization failed

D3D9/D3D11 initialization failed, trying OpenGL

GfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1

OpenGL:

Version: OpenGL 4.4 [4.4.0 NVIDIA 344.48]

Renderer: GeForce GT 630/PCIe/SSE2

Vendor: NVIDIA Corporation

VRAM: 1998 MB (via DXGI)

This should not say that it couldn't use your graphics card, so it suggests you need to reinstall the driver which you can get here, [Link].

Or you have the driver but DirectX is missing, you can get that here. [Link]

Don't forget to reboot after installing drivers

Edited May 11, 2015 by sal_vager

Thank you kindly! And sorry for the tl/dr wall of text that the log is.

EDIT: Ok. Reinstalling drivers and DirectX now.

Edited May 11, 2015 by KingOfFinland
edit
Not a problem, let me know if you have any further trouble

That done did it.

Problem fixed. Thank you so much!
